alert.note: Alert for South Central Mountains (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albuquerque (Northern and Central New Mexico)
info.headline: Flood Watch issued August 11 at 3:44AM MDT until August 11 at 8:00PM MDT by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: ...FLOOD WATCH IN EFFECT FROM NOON MDT TODAY THROUGH THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flash flooding caused by excessive rainfall is possible. * WHERE...A portion of central New Mexico, including the following area, the McBride Burn Scar in the South Central Mountains. * WHEN...From Noon MDT today through this evening. * IMPACTS...Excessive runoff may result in flooding below burn scars and within rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - Rich monsoon moisture will stream north and northeastward over the south central mountains this afternoon and evening carrying showers and thunderstorms with locally heavy rainfall near and over the McBride Burn Scar. Stronger storms will be capable of producing around 1 inch of rain in less than an hour. If storms train in succession, even more rain will be possible. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: You should monitor later forecasts and be prepared to take action should Flash Flood Warnings be issued.
